question.text: Which of the following is a characteristic feature of the human cornea?

options.text: It is secreted by the conjunctiva and glandular cells.
It is also called a lacrimal gland, which secretes tears.
Blood circulation is absent in the cornea.
In old age, the cornea hardens and a white layer is deposited over it, which leads to the formation of a cataract.

solution.text: The outermost layer of the eye ball is fibrous in nature. Two - third part of this layer is opaque and lies inside the eye orbit and is known as sclera. The remaining one-third of the outer layer is transparent and bulges out to form the cornea. There is no supply of blood in cornea.
